results.title: Equilibrium: the limit of disorder
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Defines equilibrium as a state of balance between the conflicting requirements for minimum internal energy and maximum entropy of a system and shows that free energy is at a minimum in the condition of equilibrium. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Molecules at work (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Shows that most of the energy that is used by man is derived from chemical re-actions. Illustrates how chemical energy is converted to heat and how the heat is converted into work as efficiently as possible. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Legacy : a promise for the future : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Six members of Melbourne Legacy give their individual stories of how they got into contact with Legacy. Whether they are survivors of war, employees of Legacy or the children of soldiers, Legacy manages make a significant impression on the lives of its members and provides inspiration for future generations.

results.title: Entropy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Using the experiments used to discuss enthalpy the concept of entropy is developed showing that in any spontaneous change in an isolated system there is an increase in entropy. The film also shows how the National Physical Laboratory determines the entropy of a substance

results.title: The Second law of thermodynamics (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Discusses and illustrates the second law of thermodynamics which states that every system which is left to itself will, on the average, change towards a position of maximum probability. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: A Dose of reality
results.creator_credit: Andrew Dobbyn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Andrew Dobbyn feels he has lived a privileged life. A baby boomer with a war veteran father, Dobbyn’s family did what they could to help the wives and children of those who didn’t return from the war. Despite this, Dobbyn felt he could be doing more and highlights two events in his life that showed him just how lucky he is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew Dobbyn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Turning, facing and boring
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lathework series”.
A flanged bush of phosphor bronze is seen being machined from a rough casting, a job which introduced the operations mentioned in the title of the film. The different tools used are mounted on a four-way tool post, and each in turn is seen in use. Chamfering is also demonstrated.

results.title: An Introduction to the lathe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lathework series”.
Various operations are shown briefly, then a simple type of lathe is examined systematically, headstock, cradle, tailstock, methods of holding the work by chucks, by face plate and between centres. Methods of feed, hand and automatic.
